medical_history.chief_complaint: Resistance to Thyroid Hormone mediated by defective thyroid hormone receptor alpha.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 10 days postpartum with intermittent cyanosis and constipation. At 3 months, the patient displayed macroglossia, sleepiness, and poor feeding. Initially treated for congenital hypothyroidism at 3 months, the patient experienced developmental delays and intermittent hospitalizations due to thyroid-related issues until adulthood. Thyroxine therapy started and stopped at various intervals to manage growth and thyroid levels.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Congenital hypothyroidism diagnosed in infancy, characterized by growth retardation and associated symptoms. Previous episodes of grand mal seizures before age 2 years and recurrence at age 20. Chronic cognitive impairment with learning disabilities.
medical_history.social_history: Patient lives in a care home due to cognitive impairment and persistent lethargy, with previous episodes of depression and hallucinations.
